results.name: Difference between the maximal digit value used when A108951(n) is written in primorial base and its 2-adic valuation.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
mathematica: With[{b = Reverse@ Prime@ Range@ 120}, Array[Max@ IntegerDigits[#, MixedRadix[b]] &@ Apply[Times, Map[#1^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> {Times @@ Prime@ Range@ PrimePi@ p, e}]] - PrimeOmega[#] &, 105] ] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 18 2019 *)
program: A328114(n) = { my(s=0, p=2); while(n, s = max(s,(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (s); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 18 2019
